GOD.content: when Platonism, light or son of Good (invisible source of intelligible visibility) becomes Christian faith (a gaze)
GOD.linkedContent: when Platonism, light or son of Good (invisible source of intelligible visibility) becomes Christian faith (a gaze)

PP.content: Plato: sensible sun as offspring of Good
PP.linkedContent: Plato: sensible sun as offspring of Good

PP.content: one must turn away from the blinding sun toward logos
PP.linkedContent: one must turn away from the blinding sun toward logos

PP.content: acc. king, sun, Thoth is a flimflam artist
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, sun, Thoth is a flimflam artist

PP.content: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy
PP.linkedContent: disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy

VP.content: phoneme is the phenomenon of the labyrinth, soaring up to the sun of presence, it is the path of Icarus
VP.linkedContent: phoneme is the phenomenon of the labyrinth, soaring up to the sun of presence, it is the path of Icarus

WM.content: Saussure: even the sun does not have a fixed value as a signifier; in Mallarmé, we find “fantasmagoric settings of the sun” [due to syntax]
WM.linkedContent: Saussure: even the sun does not have a fixed value as a signifier; in Mallarmé, we find “fantasmagoric settings of the sun” [due to syntax]

WM.content: “optic metaphor opens up every theoretical point of view under the sun”
WM.linkedContent: “optic metaphor opens up every theoretical point of view under the sun”

WM.content: sun in Plato’s Republic (VI-VII); strangely, Aristotle discusses the power of metaphors when a missing term must be invented > i.e. sun cast forth flame,“sowing around a god-created flame”; Derrida wonders if this is more an “enigma,” secret narrative, asyndeton, than a metaphor
WM.linkedContent: sun in Plato’s Republic (VI-VII); strangely, Aristotle discusses the power of metaphors when a missing term must be invented > i.e. sun cast forth flame,“sowing around a god-created flame”; Derrida wonders if this is more an “enigma,” secret narrative, asyndeton, than a metaphor

WM.content: if, acc. Aristotle, every metaphor is an elliptical comparison or analogy, then the metaphor comparing sun’s flames to sowing seed is metaphor par excellence, an ellipsis of ellipsis
WM.linkedContent: if, acc. Aristotle, every metaphor is an elliptical comparison or analogy, then the metaphor comparing sun’s flames to sowing seed is metaphor par excellence, an ellipsis of ellipsis

WM.content: for Aristotle, proper name is nonmetaphorical prime mover of metaphor, father of all figures > everything turns around it, towards it
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, proper name is nonmetaphorical prime mover of metaphor, father of all figures > everything turns around it, towards it

WM.content: sun’s referent has originality of always being original, unique, irreplaceable
WM.linkedContent: sun’s referent has originality of always being original, unique, irreplaceable

WM.content: sun turns in metaphor, philosophical metaphor turns toward the sun, flower of rhetoric, un tournesol, heliotrope
WM.linkedContent: sun turns in metaphor, philosophical metaphor turns toward the sun, flower of rhetoric, un tournesol, heliotrope

WM.content: since sensory sun can never be known all metaphors will be im-proper to it
WM.linkedContent: since sensory sun can never be known all metaphors will be im-proper to it

WM.content: sun is the paradigm of sensory and of metaphor: it turns and hides; first because aisthēton, sensory, can always not present itself [sun set], and second because it is exactly w/ metaphor that sensory absents itself: thus all metaphor attempts to describe turning of the sun
WM.linkedContent: sun is the paradigm of sensory and of metaphor: it turns and hides; first because aisthēton, sensory, can always not present itself [sun set], and second because it is exactly w/ metaphor that sensory absents itself: thus all metaphor attempts to describe turning of the sun

WM.content: metaphor means heliotrope: turned toward the sun, turning movement of the sun
WM.linkedContent: metaphor means heliotrope: turned toward the sun, turning movement of the sun

WM.content: if best metaphor is never absolutely good, wouldn’t bad metaphor be the best example?
WM.linkedContent: if best metaphor is never absolutely good, wouldn’t bad metaphor be the best example?

WM.content: [exemplary nature of sun in relation to metaphor] if sun is always metaphorical, it has lustre [Mallarmé], is an artificial construction, always other than itself, emerging from itself (father, eye, seed, fire, egg)
WM.linkedContent: [exemplary nature of sun in relation to metaphor] if sun is always metaphorical, it has lustre [Mallarmé], is an artificial construction, always other than itself, emerging from itself (father, eye, seed, fire, egg)

WM.content: when syntax is subordinated to semantics in concept of metaphor, what else will be found than a return to the same, the sun, the light, same circle, the dominant metaphor of the group, heightened by its power of dissimulation, escaping mastery: God or Sun?
WM.linkedContent: when syntax is subordinated to semantics in concept of metaphor, what else will be found than a return to the same, the sun, the light, same circle, the dominant metaphor of the group, heightened by its power of dissimulation, escaping mastery: God or Sun?

WM.content: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope
WM.linkedContent: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope

WM.content: the East is where the sensible sun rises, the sun sets, is interiorized, in heart (eye) of the West
WM.linkedContent: the East is where the sensible sun rises, the sun sets, is interiorized, in heart (eye) of the West

DS.content: for Mallarmé, ideality of idea, metaphysical name, is necessary to mark non-being, nonpresent, marks w/out breaking glass, alludes to epekeina tēs ousias: a hymen (closeness & veil) btwn Plato’s sun & Mallarmé’s lustre
DS.linkedContent: for Mallarmé, ideality of idea, metaphysical name, is necessary to mark non-being, nonpresent, marks w/out breaking glass, alludes to epekeina tēs ousias: a hymen (closeness & veil) btwn Plato’s sun & Mallarmé’s lustre

BSi.content: scene, theater, visibility of autopsy [sovereign]: violence of light > enargeia of seeing, knowing; enargeia: fulguration of sun, can’t look at directly
BSi.linkedContent: scene, theater, visibility of autopsy [sovereign]: violence of light > enargeia of seeing, knowing; enargeia: fulguration of sun, can’t look at directly

O.content: the point is to work to set up or dismantle a scaffold, a scaffolding (un échafaudage), we need one to substitute, the time of a lapse, Mallarmé’s lustre for Plato’s sun
O.linkedContent: the point is to work to set up or dismantle a scaffold, a scaffolding (un échafaudage), we need one to substitute, the time of a lapse, Mallarmé’s lustre for Plato’s sun

LG.content: l’épreuve of a récit brought to light the madness of genre—spinning (faire tourner) Peterson’s genre-disc, comme un soleil fou > dividing borders btwn literature and its others

OG.content: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]
OG.linkedContent: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]

FV.content: psychoanalysis [Freud, Bonaparte] justifies crushing monotony of monosemic truth under heading Wiederholungszwang [i.e. Freud declaring sun another sublimated symbol of father]
